unnormalised: Okay, so someone asked about AI replacing our jobs, huh? Well, let me tell you, as a software engineer sweating deadlines in Bangalore, I’ve thought about this more than I care to admit! Jokes aside, AI is definitely changing the landscape. I mean, even I'm using ChatGPT v4 to debug my code now (don't tell my manager!). But will it completely replace us? I'm not so sure. Remember how everyone thought computers would eliminate paper? My desk is still overflowing with it!
normalised: Okay, so someone asked about A-I replacing our jobs, huh? Well, let me tell you, as a software engineer sweating deadlines in Bangalore, I’ve thought about this more than I care to admit! Jokes aside, A-I is definitely changing the landscape. I mean, even I'm using Chat-G-P-T version four to debug my code now (don't tell my manager!). But will it completely replace us? I'm not so sure. Remember how everyone thought computers would eliminate paper? My desk is still overflowing with it!

unnormalised: The thing is, AI, especially these fancy new models, still needs a lot of hand-holding. They're great at churning out code snippets or summarizing reports, but they can also go completely off the rails. I once asked an AI to generate a marketing slogan and it came up with "Buy our product, or else!". Not exactly catchy, right? Plus, all this talk about AI, and my internet speed from Airtel is still barely 2Mbps! Priorities, people, priorities!
normalised: The thing is, A-I, especially these fancy new models, still needs a lot of hand-holding. They're great at churning out code snippets or summarizing reports, but they can also go completely off the rails. I once asked an A-I to generate a marketing slogan and it came up with "Buy our product, or else!". Not exactly catchy, right? Plus, all this talk about A-I, and my internet speed from Airtel is still barely two M-B-P-S! Priorities, people, priorities!

unnormalised: Ultimately, I think AI will augment our abilities, not replace them. We'll be more like AI-powered cyborgs, cranking out work faster and making fewer mistakes (hopefully!). So, for now, I'm not updating my resume just yet. I will however, use AI to write a resignation letter in advance which is due on 31/12/2024 in case things go south and I get replaced by a bot running on 16GB RAM. Wish me luck!
normalised: Ultimately, I think A-I will augment our abilities, not replace them. We'll be more like A-I powered cyborgs, cranking out work faster and making fewer mistakes (hopefully!). So, for now, I'm not updating my resume just yet. I will however, use A-I to write a resignation letter in advance which is due on thirty first december two thousand and twenty four in case things go south and I get replaced by a bot running on sixteen G-B R-A-M. Wish me luck!
